thread.title: Donald Trump brands Meryl Streep 'the most over-rated actress in Hollywood' after she slams him at Golden Globes
thread.title_full: Donald Trump brands Meryl Streep 'the most over-rated actress in Hollywood' after she slams him at Golden Globes

author: Jennifer ruby
title: Donald Trump brands Meryl Streep 'the most over-rated actress in Hollywood' after she slams him at Golden Globes
text:
Donald Trump brands Meryl Streep ‘the most over-rated actress in Hollywood’ after she slams him at Golden Globes 
The President-elect attempted to defend himself in a series of tweets Monday 9 January 2017 12:00 BST Hitting back: Donald Trump slams Meryl Streep after her Golden Globes speech AP 
Donald Trump has hit back at Meryl Streep after she slammed him at the Golden Globes , calling her the “most over-rated actress in Hollywood”. 
The President-elect fired off a series of defensive tweets on Monday morning, hours after Streep called him out for appearing to mock a disabled reporter. 
He wrote: “Meryl Streep, one of the most over-rated actresses in Hollywood, doesn't know me but attacked last night at the Golden Globes. She is a 
“Hillary flunky who lost big. For the 100th time, I never "mocked" a disabled reporter (would never do that) but simply showed him Meryl Streep, one of the most over-rated actresses in Hollywood, doesn't know me but attacked last night at the Golden Globes. She is a — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 9, 2017 Hillary flunky who lost big. For the 100th time, I never "mocked" a disabled reporter (would never do that) but simply showed him — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 9, 2017 "groveling" when he totally changed a 16 year old story that he had written in order to make me look bad. Just more very dishonest media! — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) January 9, 2017 
““groveling" when he totally changed a 16 year old story that he had written in order to make me look bad. Just more very dishonest media!” 
In Streep’s powerful Cecil B. DeMille Award acceptance speech on Sunday night, which was lauded as the best of the evening, she talked about how important it is for those in power to set an example. 
Without directly mentioning Trump’s name, the A-lister referenced the time the soon-to-be President seemed to mocked a New York Times reporter for his disability. Golden Globes: Meryl Streep condemns Donald Trump's behaviour 
“There was one performance this year that stunned me. It sank its hooks in my heart. Not because it was good; there was nothing good about it. But it was effective and it did its job. It made its intended audience laugh, and show their teeth,” she said. 
“It was that moment when the person asking to sit in the most respected seat in our country imitated a disabled reporter. Golden Globe Awards 2017 - In pictures Golden Globe Awards 2017 - In pictures 1/37 
Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone Reuters
